content.question: A company claims they produce their mixed bag of candies so that, of the candies in the bag, 20 percent are dark chocolate, 60 percent are milk chocolate, and 20 percent are white chocolate. In a random sample of candies of size 50, the counts are as follows: 6 dark, 32 milk, and 12 white. Assuming the conditions for inference are met, what is the test statistic for a chi-square goodness-of-fit test to investigate whether the distribution of the sample is consistent with the company’s claim?

choices.label: <math alttext="chi square equals 6 squared plus 32 squared plus 12 squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="chi square equals 10 squared plus 30 squared plus 10 squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="chi square equals open parenthesis, 6 minus 10, close parenthesis, squared, plus open parenthesis, 32 minus 30, close parenthesis, squared, plus open parenthesis 12 minus 10, close parenthesis, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>32</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 6 minus 10, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 10, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 32 minus 30, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 30, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 12 minus 10, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>32</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 10 minus 6, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 6, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis 30 minus 32, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 32, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 10 minus 12, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>32</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 6 minus 10, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 10, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 32 minus 30, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 30, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 12 minus 10, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>32</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.3: Carrying out a Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
